intro: Wikstroemia paxiana, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptic in shape, and have a smooth, glossy surface. Wikstroemia paxiana is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and stream banks.
